answeredQuestions.target-users: Developers using TeamBot CLI, evaluators/decision-makers, CI pipelines
answeredQuestions.core-problem: TeamBot launches with a plain 'TeamBot Starting' text panel — no branding, no animation, no communication of multi-agent identity
answeredQuestions.success-metrics: Animation plays on run/init, 3-4s duration, disableable via flag and config, graceful degradation, clean terminal handoff, tests pass
answeredQuestions.technical-stack: Python, Rich library (>=13.0.0, already installed), standard library only
answeredQuestions.testing-approach: pytest with mocking for terminal output, following existing test patterns (monkeypatch, tmp_path, class-based organisation)
answeredQuestions.scope-boundaries: New animation.py module + CLI flag + config setting + CLI integration. Out: interactive skip, custom themes, sound, external assets
answeredQuestions.animation-duration: 3-4 seconds total, feels snappy not sluggish
answeredQuestions.disable-mechanisms: --no-animation CLI flag (both run and init), show_startup_animation config field, TTY auto-detection
answeredQuestions.degradation-strategy: Static ASCII banner fallback for no-colour/no-Unicode/no-TTY terminals
answeredQuestions.terminal-compatibility: macOS Terminal, iTerm2, Linux GNOME/Konsole, Windows Terminal. Not targeting legacy cmd.exe
answeredQuestions.integration-points: cli.py run_command() and init_command(), config/loader.py defaults/validation, visualization/__init__.py exports
answeredQuestions.colour-palette-source: AGENT_COLORS dict in visualization/console.py: pm=blue, ba=cyan, writer=magenta, builder-1=green, builder-2=yellow, reviewer=red
answeredQuestions.external-dependencies: None new — Rich and stdlib only
answeredQuestions.ci-environment-handling: Auto-disable when stdout is not a TTY via Console.is_terminal or sys.stdout.isatty()
